meanings.definition: To certify or attest to the authenticity of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary will notarize the contract to make it official.
meanings.sent2: It is important to notarize legal documents to prevent fraud.
meanings.sent3: The notary accidentally notarized the wrong page of the document.
meanings.sent4: She notarized the will, sealing the fate of the inheritance.
meanings.sent5: The stamp used to notarize the papers had a fancy design.

meanings.definition: To witness or verify the signing of a document by a notary public.
meanings.sent1: The notary will notarize the deed once all parties have signed.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to notarize the form after signing it.
meanings.sent3: The notary had to notarize the same document three times due to mistakes.
meanings.sent4: He felt relieved after the notary notarized the agreement, confirming its validity.
meanings.sent5: The notary's job is to notarize signatures to ensure they are genuine.
